Models for Training

pretrained_model_name_or_path

Base Model File Path

Dataset Settings

train_data_dir

Training Dataset Path

reg_data_dir

Regularization Dataset Path. Default is empty, no use of regularized images

resolution

Training Image Resolution, Width x Height. Supports non-square, but must be a multiple of 64.

Save Settings

output_name

Model Save Name

output_dir

Model Save Folder

save_every_n_epochs

Automatically Save Model Every N Epochs

Training-related Parameters

max_train_epochs

Maximum Training Epochs

train_batch_size

Batch Size

Learning Rate and Optimizer Settings

unet_lr

U-Net Learning Rate

text_encoder_lr

Text Encoder Learning Rate

lr_scheduler

Learning Rate Scheduler Settings

lr_warmup_steps

Learning Rate Warmup Steps

lr_scheduler_num_cycles

Restart Cycles

optimizer_type

Optimizer Settings

enable_preview

Enable Training Preview Images

Network Settings

network_weights

Continue Training from Existing LoRA Model, Fill in Path

network_dim

Network Dimension, commonly used between 4 and 128, bigger isn't always better

network_alpha

Commonly the same as network_dim or a smaller value, like half of network_dim. Using smaller alpha requires increasing the learning rate.

Caption Options

shuffle_caption

Randomly shuffle tokens during training

keep_tokens

Keep the first N tokens unchanged when shuffling tokens

#

LoRA Training Beginner ModeDefault settings have prepared all the required parameters for you. You only need to modify the base model path, training dataset path, and the number of training epochs to train the model with a single click.
